net.florianschoppmann.java.futures

Class Futures

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.florianschoppmann.java.futures.Futures

  • public final class Futures
extends Object
    This class consists exclusively of static methods that operate on CompletionStage and CompletableFuture instances.

    • Method Detail

      • shortCircuitCollect

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<List<T>> shortCircuitCollect(Iterable<? extends CompletionStage<? extends T>> completionStages)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture that will normally be completed with the list of results of all given completion stages. The future will fail early if any of the given stages are completed exceptionally.

        If any of the given completion stages completes exceptionally, then the returned future is completed with a CompletionException. This is either the first encountered exception (in the order of the given Iterable) if that is a CompletionException, or otherwise a fresh CompletionException holding the first encountered exception as cause.

        Unlike collect(Iterable), the returned future may be completed before all completion stages are completed. Specifically, in case of exceptional completion of the returned future, some of the given completion stages may not yet be completed.

        The order of the given completion stages is preserved in the result list.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type of the list that the new future will be completed with
        Parameters:
        completionStages - completion stages supplying the elements of the list that the returned future will be completed with
        Returns:
        the new future

      • collect

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<List<T>> collect(Iterable<? extends CompletionStage<? extends T>> completionStages)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture that will normally be completed with a list of results of all given completion stages.

        If any of the given completion stages completes exceptionally, then the returned future is completed with a CompletionException. This is either the first encountered exception (in the order of the given Iterable) if that is a CompletionException, or otherwise a fresh CompletionException holding the first encountered exception as cause.

        Similar to CompletableFuture.allOf(CompletableFuture[]), this method guarantees that the returned future will only be completed after all given completion stages have completed.

        The order of the given completion stages is preserved in the result list.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type of the list that the new future will be completed with
        Parameters:
        completionStages - completion stages supplying the elements of the list that the returned future will be completed with
        Returns:
        future that will be completed with a list of the values that the given futures will be completed with

      • supply

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> supply(CheckedSupplier<T> supplier)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture that is already completed with the value obtained by calling the given CheckedSupplier.

        While calling this method is normally equivalent to calling CompletableFuture.completedFuture(Object) with the value returned by the given supplier, this method can be helpful when chaining multiple futures, and the exception handling for the initial computation stage is supposed to be identical with the one in later stages. Just like CompletableFuture.supplyAsync(Supplier, Executor), the returned future will be completed with a CompletionException if the given supplier throws.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the function's return type
        Parameters:
        supplier - a function returning the value to be used to complete the returned CompletableFuture
        Returns:
        the new future

      • supplyAsync

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> supplyAsync(CheckedSupplier<T> supplier,
                                                   Executor executor)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture that is asynchronously completed by a task running in the given executor with the value obtained by calling the given CheckedSupplier.

        Just like CompletableFuture.supplyAsync(Supplier, Executor), the returned future will be completed with a CompletionException if the given supplier throws.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the function's return type
        Parameters:
        supplier - a function returning the value to be used to complete the returned CompletableFuture
        executor - the executor to use for asynchronous execution
        Returns:
        the new future
        See Also:
        CompletableFuture.supplyAsync(Supplier, Executor)

      • completedExceptionally

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> completedExceptionally(Throwable throwable)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture that is already exceptionally completed with the given Throwable.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the value (if the future had completed normally)
        Parameters:
        throwable - the failure
        Returns:
        the exceptionally completed future

      • completeWith

        public static <T> void completeWith(CompletableFuture<T> completableFuture,
                                    CompletionStage<T> completionStage)
        When the given CompletionStage completes either normally or exceptionally, completes the given CompletableFuture with its result.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the result value if the stage completes normally
        Parameters:
        completableFuture - future that will be completed with the result of completionStage
        completionStage - completion stage providing the result for completableFuture

      • unwrapCompletionException

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> unwrapCompletionException(CompletionStage<T> completionStage)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture that will be completed in the same way as the given stage. However, in case of exceptional completion with a CompletionException, the returned future will be exceptionally completed with the cause held in the CompletionException.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of result of the completion stage
        Parameters:
        completionStage - the completion stage that may be completed with a CompletionException
        Returns:
        the new future

      • thenApply

        public static <T,U> CompletableFuture<U> thenApply(CompletionStage<T> completionStage,
                                                   CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends U> checkedFunction)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture that, when the given stage completes normally, is executed with that stage's result as the argument to the supplied function. See the CompletionStage documentation for rules covering exceptional completion.

        If function was a Function instance identical to checkedFunction, except for not throwing checked exceptions, then this method is equivalent to completionStage.thenApply(function).

        Type Parameters:
        T - the function's argument type
        U - the function's return type
        Parameters:
        completionStage - the completion stage providing the result for the given function
        checkedFunction - the function to use to compute the value of the returned CompletableFuture
        Returns:
        the new future

      • thenApplyAsync

        public static <T,U> CompletableFuture<U> thenApplyAsync(CompletionStage<T> completionStage,
                                                        CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends U> checkedFunction,
                                                        Executor executor)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture that, when the given stage completes normally, is executed using the supplied Executor, with the given stage's result as the argument to the supplied function. See the CompletionStage documentation for rules covering exceptional completion.

        If function was a Function instance identical to checkedFunction, except for not throwing checked exceptions, then this method is equivalent to completionStage.thenApplyAsync(function, executor).

        Type Parameters:
        T - the function's argument type
        U - the function's return type
        Parameters:
        completionStage - the completion stage providing the result for the given function
        checkedFunction - the function to use to compute the value of the returned CompletableFuture
        executor - the executor to use for asynchronous execution
        Returns:
        the new future

      • thenCompose

        public static <T,U> CompletableFuture<U> thenCompose(CompletionStage<T> completionStage,
                                                     CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends CompletionStage<U>> checkedFunction)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture that, when the given stage completes normally, is executed with that stage as the argument to the supplied function. See the CompletionStage documentation for rules covering exceptional completion.

        If function was a Function instance identical to checkedFunction, except for not throwing checked exceptions, then this method is equivalent to completionStage.thenCompose(function).

        Type Parameters:
        T - the function's argument type
        U - the type of the returned CompletionStage's result
        Parameters:
        completionStage - the completion stage providing the result for the given function
        checkedFunction - the function returning a new CompletionStage
        Returns:
        the new future

      • thenComposeAsync

        public static <T,U> CompletableFuture<U> thenComposeAsync(CompletionStage<T> completionStage,
                                                          CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends CompletionStage<U>> checkedFunction,
                                                          Executor executor)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture that, when the given stage completes normally, is executed using the supplied Executor, with the given stage's result as the argument to the supplied function. See the CompletionStage documentation for rules covering exceptional completion.

        If function was a Function instance identical to checkedFunction, except for not throwing checked exceptions, then this method is equivalent to completionStage.thenComposeAsync(function, executor).

        Type Parameters:
        T - the function's argument type
        U - the type of the returned CompletionStage's result
        Parameters:
        completionStage - the completion stage providing the result for the given function
        checkedFunction - the function returning a new CompletionStage
        executor - the executor to use for asynchronous execution
        Returns:
        the new future

      • whenComplete

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> whenComplete(CompletionStage<T> completionStage,
                                                    CheckedBiConsumer<? super T,? super Throwable> action)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture with the same result or exception as the given stage, that executes the given action when the given stage completes.

        When the given stage is complete, the given action is invoked with the result (or null if none) and the exception (or null if none) of the given stage as arguments. The returned future is completed when the action returns. If the supplied action itself encounters an exception, then the returned future exceptionally completes with this exception unless the given stage also completed exceptionally.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the action's first argument type
        Parameters:
        completionStage - the completion stage providing the result or exception for the given action
        action - the action to perform
        Returns:
        the new future

      • whenCompleteAsync

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> whenCompleteAsync(CompletionStage<T> completionStage,
                                                         CheckedBiConsumer<? super T,? super Throwable> action,
                                                         Executor executor)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture with the same result or exception as the given stage, that executes the given action using the supplied Executor when the given stage completes.

        When the given stage is complete, the given action is invoked with the result (or null if none) and the exception (or null if none) of the given stage as arguments. The returned future is completed when the action returns. If the supplied action itself encounters an exception, then the returned future exceptionally completes with this exception unless the given stage also completed exceptionally.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the action's first argument type
        Parameters:
        completionStage - the completion stage providing the result or exception for the given action
        executor - the executor to use for asynchronous execution
        action - the action to perform
        Returns:
        the new future

      • translateException

        public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> translateException(CompletionStage<T> completionStage,
                                                          Function<Throwable,Throwable> function)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture that is normally completed with the same result as the given stage. If the given stage completed exceptionally, the given function is called with the exception as argument and the returned future is completed exceptionally with the result.

        The exception returned by function is not wrapped in a CompletionException. However, if an exception E occurs in the given function, the returned future will be completed exceptionally with a CompletionException containing E as cause.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the completion stage
        Parameters:
        completionStage - the completion stage providing the exception for the given function
        function - the exception-translation function
        Returns:
        the new future

      • thenApplyWithResourceAsync

        public static <R extends AutoCloseable,T> CompletableFuture<T> thenApplyWithResourceAsync(CompletionStage<R> resourceStage,
                                                                                          CheckedFunction<? super R,? extends T> function,
                                                                                          Executor executor)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture that, when the given stage completes normally, is executed using the supplied Executor, with the given stage's result as the argument to the supplied function. See the CompletionStage documentation for rules covering exceptional completion.

        This method behaves like thenApplyAsync(CompletionStage, CheckedFunction, Executor), but it ensures that the resource passed to function is properly closed, even if an exception occurs at any stage. This method may thus be regarded as an asynchronous try-with-resources implementation (with just one resource: The R instance that resourceStage will is completed with).

        Similar to try-with-resources, if an exception occurs after the AutoCloseable resource has been opened, then any further exception while automatically closing the resource will be added as suppressed exception. Suppressed exceptions are added to the original exception, not the CompletionException that the returned future would be completed with and that contains the original exception as cause.

        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the resource returned by the given completion stage
        T - the type of the value returned by the given function
        Parameters:
        resourceStage - completion stage that will be completed with an AutoCloseable
        function - function computing the result for the new future
        executor - the executor to use for asynchronous execution
        Returns:
        the new future

      • thenComposeWithResource

        public static <R extends AutoCloseable,T> CompletableFuture<T> thenComposeWithResource(CompletionStage<R> resourceStage,
                                                                                       CheckedFunction<? super R,? extends CompletionStage<T>> function)
        Returns a new CompletableFuture that, when the given stage completes normally, is executed with that stage as the argument to the supplied function. See the CompletionStage documentation for rules covering exceptional completion.

        This method behaves like thenCompose(CompletionStage, CheckedFunction), but it ensures that the resource passed to function is properly closed, even if an exception occurs at any stage. This method may thus be regarded as an asynchronous try-with-resources implementation (with just one resource: The R instance that resourceStage will is completed with).

        Similar to try-with-resources, if an exception occurs after the AutoCloseable resource has been opened, then any further exception while automatically closing the resource will be added as suppressed exception. Suppressed exceptions are added to the original exception, not the CompletionException that the returned future would be completed with and that contains the original exception as cause.

        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the resource returned by the given completion stage
        T - the result type of the future returned by the given function
        Parameters:
        resourceStage - completion stage that will be completed with an AutoCloseable
        function - Function returning a completion stage that will compute the result for the new future.
        Returns:
        the new future
